name: Mersenne prime
rephrased: A Mersenne prime is a prime number that can be written as 2 raised to the power of a prime minus one.
implication_form: If n is composite, then 2^n - 1 is composite.
explained: A Mersenne prime is a prime number that can be expressed in the form 2^n - 1, where n is an integer. These primes are named after Marin Mersenne, who studied them. An important property is that if n is a composite number, then 2^n - 1 is also composite. Therefore, known Mersenne primes correspond to prime exponents n (though not all prime exponents yield Mersenne primes).
